title: Edmund Murray (priest)
text:
Edmund Theodore Murray (16 August 1877 – 16 February 1969) was <a href="Archdeacon%20of%20Cheltenham">Archdeacon of Cheltenham</a> from 1943 to 1951.
Murray was educated at <a href="Uppingham%20School">Uppingham School</a> and <a href="Christ%27s%20College%2C%20Cambridge">Christ's College, Cambridge</a>, and <a href="ordained">ordained</a> after a period of study at Leeds Clergy School in 1900. He served <a href="Curate">curacies</a> at <a href="Bedale">Bedale</a>, <a href="Wymondham">Wymondham</a> and <a href="Wem">Wem</a>. He was <a href="Rector%20%28ecclesiastical%29">Rector</a> of <a href="Bourton-on-the-Hill">Bourton-on-the-Hill</a> from 1906 to 1946; during which time he was a <a href="Chaplain">Chaplain</a> to the <a href="British%20Armed%20Forces">Forces</a> from 1917 to 1919. He was appointed an <a href="Canon%20%28priest%29">Honorary Canon</a> of <a href="Gloucester%20Cathedral">Gloucester Cathedral</a> in 1938.
